Guinea-Bissau - Projecto de populacao,
            saude e nutricao

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Population, Health and
            Nutrition Project in Guinea-Bissau were as follows: Overall
            impact of the project was unsatisfactory. Project
            achievements fell short of ambitious appraisal scope and
            design complexity. The benefits of components such as
            technical assistance and provision of recurrent costs were
            low in relation to their costs. Lessons learned from the
            project are: project preparation should select implement
            able key components; construction components should be
            properly prepared, although they are usually less
            significant than software components in addressing sector
            issues; although technical assistance is essential
            particularly when the capacity of the sector agencies is
            low, it should be tailored to the agency's absorptive
            capacity, and should be closely supervised; and project
            management units should help in institution building and
            receive close review from the management of the implementing
            agency. Further, national counterparts should always be
            involved in project preparation and start-up activities and,
            as much as possible, there should be continuity or, when
            staff changes are unavoidable, there should be well planned
            and smooth transition of Government counterparts during implementation.
